title: Class A track: Cheverus girls repeat, Falmouth and Thornton share boys title
content: BATH — The Cheverus girls won five individual events and the 1,600-meter relay to capture their second straight Class A track and field championship, while the Falmouth boys caught Thornton Academy at the end to earn a share the title on Saturday at McMann Field.    It was Falmouth’s first Class A state track and field title after moving up from Class B in 2014.    The Thornton boys dominated much of the meet by winning five individual events with junior Travis Synder (110 hurdles, 300 hurdles pole vault) won three events and junior Jason Montano (shot out, discus) won two.    This story will be updated
